attributes.action: change the law to make it illegal for politicians to use public funds to entertain their celebrity friends at parties which have no political purpose other than to enhance the standing of the politician amongst that group of celebrities.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tony Bliar is the latest in a long line of elected politicians who have entertained many A and B List celebrities - who themselves expend more money on avoiding the payment of income tax than taxpayers contribute to the running of the country - at Chequers (a publicly owned building) and misused public funds to pay for it.  Taking money off pensioners, who are already having their disposable funds reduced to poverty levels by this government, to fund the self aggrandisement of individual politicians is tantamount to theft and a betrayal of those taxpayers.
